channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS

item.description:
Report X-2024021715

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found at the start of the trailer on its side. It was leaking when the trailer was opened. DescribePack: The package leaked from the top of the bottle. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote and the spill was cleaned using a stabilizing powder and PPE.

item.title: Report X-2024021794
item.description:
Report X-2024021794

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a pacakge handler was unloading, he noticed that was leaking and he told to his manger. DescribePack: the pacakge was on its side and one gallon got loose cap and spilled out about 4 ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manage called QA and QA went to the area with a red tote line with a pacakge handler and clean the area and brought the pacakge to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2024021559
item.description:
Report X-2024021559

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER DONNED PPE INCLUDING GLOVES, APRON, BOOTS, AND GOGGLES. THE RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE UPS DECISION TREE. CLAY BASED ABSORBENT WAS USED TO SOLIDIFY ALL SPILLED LIQUID. THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND ALL CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WERE TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA FOR DISPOSAL. ITEMS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING UPS WASTE DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER PICKED UP THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION. AFTER GOING THROUGH THE BOX, RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT ONE OF THE TWO BOTTLES WAS SHATTERED.

item.title: Report X-2024021214
item.description:
Report X-2024021214

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING OUT AND NOTIFIED THE MANAGER THE MANAGER THEN NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ALL FOUR OF THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAPS SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1-gallon of UN1090 "Klean-Strip Acetone" was released from (1) 1-gallon metal pail only impacting the cardboard the product was shipped inside. The pallet was double stacked and unsecured and fell over in transit.

item.title: Report X-2024021609
item.description:
Report X-2024021609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LOADER NOTICED LEAKING PACKAGE AND CALLED RESPONDER WHO DISCOVERED PACKAGE WITH CORROSIVE AND OXIDIZER DIAMOND LABELS. SINGLE WALLED CARDBOARD BOX WITH A PLASTIC JERRICAN INSIDE. DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED A SMALL AMOUNT OF KRAFT PAPER PADDED THE JERRICAN ON THREE SIDES AND THE BOTTOM OF THE JERRICAN WAS CRACKED ON THE PLASTIC SEAM.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While I was doing a dock walk, I found a box with the corner wet. DescribePack: The package had a corner wet, because a gallon got loose cap and spilled out about 4 ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I grab a red tote line with a hazmat bag, I place the package in the tote and brought to the processing cage and start working on it.

THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024021679
item.description:
Report X-2024021679

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH THE CLEAN UP. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING THE GUIDLINES IN THE DECSION TREE. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024021507
item.description:
Report X-2024021507

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2024021507 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER OPENED THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND PLACED IN A TOTE. THE MANAGER NOTICED THE SITUATION AND IMMEDIATELY NOTIFIED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA QUICKLY GRABBED A TOTE WITH FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD AND NOTICED THE LEAKING HAZMATS IN A TOTE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. ONCE THE AREA WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER. 2. X-2024021508 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER OPENED THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND PLACED IN A TOTE. THE MANAGER NOTICED THE SITUATION AND IMMEDIATELY NOTIFIED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA QUICKLY GRABBED A TOTE WITH FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD AND NOTICED THE LEAKING HAZMATS IN A TOTE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. ONCE THE AREA WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER.

DescribePack: The pail got loose cap and leaked out about two liquid pounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manger called QA and QA went to the area pick the package and brought to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020909
item.description:
Report X-2024020909

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to be wet in the unload, QA was called and the package was placed in a plastic lined tote. DescribePack: 1 bucket had a loose lid and leaked the flammable liquid from the wipes. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic lined tote and brought to QA for examination.

item.title: Report X-2024021530
item.description:
Report X-2024021530

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to be damaged by Ops Manager Nick Nolte when a PH pulled it off the belt to process it as an NC. Nick Nolte segregated package on a pallet and called QA to remove it. The spill was internal and did not affect other packages or the trailer. DescribePack: The package had a loose cap that caused internal leakage. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: The package was separated from other packages and placed in a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021302
item.description:
Report X-2024021302

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CLERK WAS WORKING IN SC AREA. HE DISCOVERED A PACKAGE WITH A DOUBLE LABEL. PACKAGE WAS OPENED IN ATTEMPT TO DETERMINE CORRECT DISPOSITION OF SHIPMENT. INTERNAL PACKAGING WAS HAZMARKED UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERY WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. NO EXTERNAL DG MARKS/LABELING OR SHIPPING PAPERS. UNDECLARED HAZMAT DISCOVERED.
